description: Fresh, minerally lime aromas set up a zesty palate with lemon-lime, pineapple and apple flavors. There's nothing complicated about this snappy white, which finishes with some bitterness and lasting acidity.
title: Doña Paula 2015 Los Cardos Sauvignon Blanc (Mendoza)

description: This smooth, wood-aged wine is ripe with red fruits, soft tannins and a generous, full-bodied character. The acidity keeps the wine in shape, round and ready to drink.
title: Falua 2014 Conde Vimioso Colheita Seleccionada Red (Tejo)

description: Two rounded, ripe varietals give a rich, smooth wine. It has just a touch of perfume from Fernão Pires, made ripe by the creamy Chardonnay. Pear fruit is cut with balanced acidity. Drink now.
title: Falua 2015 Tagus Creek Chardonnay-Fernão Pires White (Tejo)

description: The wine is just off dry, with a soft tropical-fruit character. It has pineapple as well as lemon fruit, crisp acidity and dried apricot flavors. The wine is crisp at the end, and ready to drink.
title: Famille Laplace 2015 Aramis Petit Manseng-Sauvignon White (Vin de France)

description: Dusty, lightly woody aromas are smooth and easy to like. Peachy in feel, with moderate acidity, this tastes of peach and papaya in front of a melony, ripe finish that's a bit soft, so drink now.
title: Finca Sophenia 2015 Altosur Chardonnay (Tupungato)

description: Aromas of sawdust, oak, espresso and dark cooking spice lead the nose. The palate is somewhat muddled, showing ripe black cherry, raspberry, sweet and sour sauce and a hint of bitter chocolate alongside robust tannins and rather soft acidity.
title: Gemma 2012 Colarej  (Barolo)

description: Spicy, rubbery aromas of plum and berry fruits feature a coating of heavy oak. This is tannic and narrow on the palate, while burnt, herbal berry flavors finish rooty and with rubbery tannic grab.
title: Graffito 2014 Malbec (Luján de Cuyo)

description: While not overly intense in grapefruit, gooseberry and pea-shoot aromas, the palate brings a bit more frivolity into play, with guava, peach and flint. There's some weight behind this wine, which takes it beyond a simple apéritif.
title: Veritas 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Monticello)

description: A shade off dry, this approachably fresh fruity Riesling offers a bounty of juicy peach and tangerine refreshment. Sunny lemon acidity and blossom notes extend through a moderately long finish.
title: Winzer Von Erbach 2014 Weinkeller Erbach Riesling (Rheingau)

description: While this Cab may be a touch soupy and heavy on the nose, aromas of coffee grounds and berry fruits are good. A full, blocky palate features cheek-rubbing tannins, while this tastes of coffee, chocolate and herbal berry fruits. For everyday purposes, this makes the grade.
title: Trivento 2014 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)

description: A ripe wine that is soft and fruity, this is juicy and with fine acidity. The quinta, situated at the western end of the Douro region, has produced a wine with light tannins and which has fine, ready to drink fruitiness.
title: Messias 2013 Quinta do Cachão Red (Douro)

description: A dry Vinho Verde with a light sparkle that give it a fine lift. With intense citrus and a sliced apple freshness, the wine is refreshing and ready to drink.
title: Obrigado 2015 Vera White (Vinho Verde)

description: Red fruit and wood are both prominent in this wine. A juicy red-currant character shows through the high-toast flavor. Attractive and fruity, it is likely to develop quickly. Drink this soft wine from 2018.
title: Patriarche Père et Fils 2014 Gravières Premier Cru  (Santenay)

description: This opens with funky aromas of game, scorched soil, roasted herb and a whiff of barnyard. The palate is on the raw side, showing sour cherry and a sprinkling of white pepper framed in raspy tannins.
title: Pecchenino 2012 Le Coste di Monforte  (Barolo)

description: Aromas of menthol, stewed prune and a whiff of dark spice carry over to the evolved palate. The tannins are still firm but this has seen better days. Drink now.
title: Pier 2007 Vila Riserva  (Barbaresco)

description: Just out, this is quite young and tart, tightly wound with green apple and green pear fruit. It's the sort of wine that may well improve considerably with an extra year in bottle. A light touch of cinnamon comes up in the aftertaste.
title: Portlandia 2015 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

description: Fresh fruit flavors of red apple and raspberry carry the wine into a light, fairly brief finish. The tannins are thin, almost stripped feeling, and there isn't enough weight to make a strong varietal statement.
title: Quady North 2012 Cabernet Franc (Applegate Valley)

description: Vines in the southern Amarante region of Vinho Verde give this wine its ripe melon and apple flavors. It is tangy, bright with ripe fruit and with a lightly mineral texture. Drink now.
title: Quinta da Calçada 2015 Portal da Calçada Reserva White (Vinho Verde)

description: A ripe blend of fresh apple and lemon fruits give this wine is crisp, dry character. It is packed with acidity, orange and lemon zest and has a lively aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Quinta da Raza 2015 Escolha White (Vinho Verde)

description: This wine is a unique blend of 59% Syrah, 31% Malbec and 10% Grenache. Dark in color for a rosé, it brings aromas of cherry and herb. The flavors tingle the palate with just off-dry flavors that seem a bit fat.
title: Longship 2016 Wild Harvest Rosé (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: A stewy nose includes notes of mashed leaves, herbal berry fruits, prune and black tea. The palate on this Merlot-Cab Sauvignon blend is heavily extracted and jammy, with hard-pounding tannins. A fully oaked set of black-fruit flavors moves towards prune, raisin and chocolate on the finish.
title: Miolo 2012 Lote 43 Merlot-Cabernet Sauvignon (Vale dos Vinhedos)

description: Cherry and latex aromas are lean and limited. This feels tight, juicy and jumpy, with raw acidity. Spicy, herbal plum and raspberry flavors lack body on a dry, racy finish.
title: Morandé 2015 Reserva Pinot Noir (Casablanca Valley)

description: This wine is intensely floral and gritty on the palate, showing a fleshy cloying sense of ripeness. Melon, pear and fig highlight the fruit profile.
title: Muscardini 2015 Ansa Di Loval Pinot Grigio (Napa Valley)

description: Coming in a 375ml can, this wine brings aromas of lees and lemon curd. The palate is creamy in feel and lightly sweet.
title: Original House Wine NV Chardonnay (America)

description: Pale salmon in color, this is an aromatic rosé with notes of peach and jasmine. It's off dry in style and brings easy drinking enjoyment.
title: Original House Wine NV Rosé (America)

description: With 4% Petite Sirah, possibly for color, this wine shows a preponderance of caramel-vanilla oak and big bones of body and concentration. Unfussy, it softens in the glass, showing cherry-cola flavor and a dash of herb.
title: Scott Family 2015 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Green beans and other vegetal notes combine with pineapple, rancid butter and wet wool in this rather odd Chardonnay. There's plenty of acidity and a creamy mouthfeel, but it's all a little out of balance.
title: Thistledown 2014 Great Escape Cool Climate Textural Chardonnay (Adelaide Hills)

description: Peach and honeysuckle stand out on the nose and palate of this wine. Ginger and nutmeg are featured in both as well. While the aromas and flavors are enticing, this wine seems a little flabby, needing a lift of acidity.
title: Veramar 2016 JB Winemaker Series Petit Manseng (Virginia)

description: This has fruity aromas of red cherry that carry over to the light-bodied no-frills palate along with a peppery note. It's simple, with easygoing, rather fleeting tannins.
title: Villabella 2016  Valpolicella Classico

description: Perfumed and lightly spicy, this is a Sauvignon Blanc that brings out the tropical fruit side of the grape. With its rich fruit and soft citrus, it is smooth and ready to drink.
title: Wines & Winemakers 2016 Monte de Baía Sauvignon Blanc (Península de Setúbal)

description: Difficult aromas of cigar ash and hickory are forceful and dominate the nose as a pair. This Tannat stamps across the palate with loud acidity and hard tannins. Toasty woody berry and plum flavors are abrupt on a rough finish.
designation: Don Nelson Gran Reserva Edición Limitada
title: Ariano Hermanos 2011 Don Nelson Gran Reserva Edición Limitada Tannat (Canelones)

description: This wine is unusually soft and luscious, easy to drink, and marked by aromas of cinnamon and brown sugar followed by ripe lightly sweet flavors of blackberry jam. It has low acidity, low tannins and medium body.
title: Auspicion 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)

description: Fresh and inviting in a strawberry aroma, the palate brings ripe red-fruit and vanilla flavors to the mix. This is a medium-bodied, softly textured wine.
title: Black Ink 2015 Red (California)

description: This is a powerful, full-bodied and tannic wine with a lot of grip in the texture, very firm tannins and decent concentration. It smells and tastes smoky, backed by some tart blackberry flavors.
title: Black's Station 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Yolo County)

description: One of the most familiar Vinho Verde brands in Portugal, this wine is medium sweet with a light prickle on the tongue. It is fruity with creamed apple and citrus along with a touch of honey. The wine is crisp and clean, delicious to drink as an apéritif.
title: Borges NV Gatão White (Vinho Verde)

description: Light bodied and easygoing, this has flavors of red cherry, strawberry and clove. It's fresh and simple, with loose-knit fleeting tannins.
title: Casetto 2015  Bardolino Classico

description: An attractive, creamy textured wine with apple as well as citrus fruits. It is soft, smooth although with plenty of acidity to keep it lively. Drink now.
title: Château du Cèdre 2016 Cedrus le Blanc Ugni Blanc-Colombard (Côtes de Gascogne)

description: All tangy fruit, this simple wine is light, with citrus and crisp pear flavors. A touch of honey adds a soft side while keeping its zesty fruit right in place. Drink now.
title: Château l'Orangerie 2016  Bordeaux Blanc

description: Soft and bright with red berry fruit, this is a warm, open and easy wine. It has a gentle texture and just enough tannins to give it shape. Drink now.
title: Château Saint-Florian 2016  Bordeaux

description: Pure Touriga Nacional, this is a crisp and fruity wine. Its red currants and light tannic structure give it shape and bring out the fruitiness that makes it immediately attractive. Ready to drink now.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2016 Brigando Rosé (Lisboa)

description: This is Gascony's classic grape blend in a wine that's both herbal and juicily fruity. Soft and light, with citrus and white currant flavors, it's ready to drink.
title: Domaine de Ménard 2016 Colombard-Ugni Blanc (Côtes de Gascogne)

description: This spicy, fruity wine, which includes the rare spicy Egiodola grape, is crisp with acidity and red currant fruit. With its touch of caramel, it's ready to drink.
title: Domaine de Ménard 2016 Rosé (Côtes de Gascogne)

description: Thin aromas of cherries and oregano show on the nose of this simple but quaffable bottling. The palate combines fruit punch and candied cherries with a hint of more herbs.
title: Esser 2014 Merlot (Monterey County)

description: This attractively soft wine is as gentle as the Gascony countryside, made with grapes from this region. It brings together many citrus flavors along with hints of pineapple and richer fruits. Drink now.
title: Famille Laplace 2016 Aramis Colombard-Sauvignon Blanc (Vin de France)

description: Smoky flavor envelops a soft supple layering of blackberry and cherry in this wine, that's big, broad and full of heat. A sweetness of oak provokes the fruit.
title: Foppiano 2015 Estate Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)

description: A rather light red color and a lean flavor profile make this medium-bodied wine a good mealtime pour that doesn't hog the spotlight. It smells like cranberries and dried earth and tastes lightly tart and cherrylike.
title: Girasole 2016 Sangiovese (Mendocino)

description: This is a young yeasty and nutty-flavored wine from the Bairrada region, home to many sparkling wines. It is crisp, with some apple fruitiness, and ready to drink. The acidity keeps it in shape.
designation: Quinta do Encontro Vinha Maria Bruto
title: Global Wines NV Quinta do Encontro Vinha Maria Bruto Sparkling (Vinho Espumante)

description: This medium-dry Muscat has aromas of white flowers and lemon blossoms. On the palate there are flavors of honeysuckle, peach and lime juice.
title: Jidvei 2016 Treasure of Transylvania Medium Dry Moscato (Tarnave)

description: This Transylvanian wines has aromas of vanilla, whipped cream, apple and pear. It is medium dry, with flavors of pear and lemon juice that lead to a touch of sweetness on the finish.
title: Jidvei 2016 Treasure of Transylvania Medium Dry Sauvignon Blanc (Tarnave)

description: Fruity, and crisp, it has citrus flavors balanced by an intense herbal character. It's fresh and juicy; the acidity gives a bright, lively aftertaste.
title: Château de Parenchère 2013  Bordeaux Blanc

description: Still young and dry, it has an austere, lean side that is still a way from being mature. Some juiciness gives a fresher potential. Drink from 2016.
title: Château Métairie Neuve 2011  Côtes de Bourg

description: This young Cabernet has aromas of black plum, vanilla and a big bowl of freshly picked blackberries. There are flavors of black fruits and freshly ground black pepper in the midpalate, with good acidity on the finish.
title: Cramele Recas 2013 Dreamfish Cabernet Sauvignon (Viile Timisului)

description: Green plums and ripe apples bring out the best in Arinto's range of flavors. This is a soft wine, with light acidity that's well integrated into the rich fruitiness. Drink now.
title: DFJ Vinhos 2013 Paxis Branco Arinto (Lisboa)

description: This soft and rounded wine has attractive lemon, peach and almond flavors. It's crisp while showing touches of honey that give a riper feel. It's ready to drink
title: Domaine du Petit Coteau 2013 Sec  (Vouvray)

description: Slightly oily, gritty aromas match wits with melon and lychee scents. The palate is propped up by adequate acidity, while flavors of melon, orange and lychee are typical and end sweet and tropical.
title: Dominio del Plata 2013 Crios Torrontés (Mendoza)

description: The nose is muted somewhat and the wine grippy yet a tad thin, its flavors a mix of licorice and dust.
title: Eagle Eye 2009 Estate AlphaWOLF Ranch Cabernet Franc (Napa Valley)

description: A wiry, fresh, slightly briny smelling nose sets up a pointed, zesty palate with electric, high-strung flavors of red plum and wild berry. The finish is hard, juicy and a little hot and fiery.
title: Zumaya 2013 Tempranillo  (Ribera del Duero)

description: A yeasty character masks the fresh fruitiness. Underneath the bready notes, grapefruit and other attractive citrus flavors are waiting to get out. Wait until 2015 to see if the wine improves.
title: Jean-Max Roger 2012 Cuvée Les Caillottes  (Sancerre)

description: Agile and glossy, this has toasty apple, pear and tropical fruit flavors that continue to a light, fresh-tasting finish.
title: Jefferson Vineyards 2012 Rsv. Chardonnay (Virginia)

description: This is a soft, still grippy Cabernet with an earthy, tobacco-infused character that somewhat overwhelms the taste of blackberry and black currant.
title: Keating 2010 Montecillo Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)

description: It still tastes very young with its aggressive acidity and herbaceous character. It's mineral, tight, with zesty lemon, lime and strong gooseberry flavors. It needs until 2015 to calm down.
title: Les Vignerons des Coteaux Romanais 2013 Château de Pont Sauvignon Blanc (Touraine)

description: Steely and crisp, this tight, very fresh wine is full of lemon zest and grapefruit flavors. It's bright, light, and taut as a wire.
title: Les Vignerons des Terroirs de la Noëlle 2013 Domaine de l'Aurière Sur Lie  (Muscadet Sèvre et Maine)
winery: Les Vignerons des Terroirs de la Noëlle

description: Fleeting leather and black fruit notes creep onto the medium-full palate, which feels malleable with its lank acids. The finish comes with a focused note of long-cut tobacco.
designation: Landscape Page Springs Estate Vineyard Yavapai County
title: Page Cellars 2010 Landscape Page Springs Estate Vineyard Yavapai County Red (Cochise County)

description: Aromas of clover honey and raisin pick up traces of baking spice and date on the palate. Astringent, bulletproof tannins brace the palate. Roquefort anyone?
title: Stinson 2011 Imperialis Tannat (Monticello)

description: Apple and peach aromas are slightly waxy and show a spot of petrol. This is citrusy but full in body, with flavors of apple, pear, melon and citrus. A plump, basic finish is monotone, but clean and fruity.
title: Alfredo Roca 2013 Fincas Chardonnay (Mendoza)

description: The low alcohol suggests fruit that was minimally ripened, and the flavors seem closer to fresh greens than ripe fruit. There's a splash of gooseberry, again quite tart, and a leesy texture. Drink chilled with a fresh salad.
title: Château Bianca 2013 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

description: For the vintage, this is a surprisingly lean wine. Some juicy fruit is still struggling out of the very dry tannic shell. Acidity is a dominant character of this firm, dry wine.
title: Château Blanchereau 2010  Côtes de Bourg

description: The wine is attractively fruity, its crispness balanced by round apple and pear flavors that give richness. It has a creamy texture, concentrated acidity and a finish that brings out lemon and lime.
title: Château Buisson-Redon 2013  Bordeaux Blanc

description: This young, fruity wine is almost ready to drink. Attractive black currant acidity and light tannins t bring a bite to the natural smoothness of the wine. Drink from 2015.
title: Château Chai Neuf 2012  Bordeaux

description: Popcorn and butter are the lead aromas, and they give way to dusty baked apple over time. This wine feels round, but with just enough acidity. Flavors of candy corn, vanilla, spun sugar and ripe stone fruits finish sweet and fleshy.
title: Tapiz 2013 Alta Collection Chardonnay (Mendoza)

description: Ripe blueberry, black plum and violet aromas are sweet and ripe. This is a chunky, flat feeling Tempranillo with candied, soft blackberry and other black-fruit flavors. A short, simple finish fits this heavy wine's overall profile.
title: Vega Moragona 2010 Tempranillo (Ribera del Júcar)

description: This is a soft wine, attractively fruity with gentle tannins. It is fresh with red berry fruits and open acidity. There is a burnt edge at the end which needs to blow off. Drink from 2015.
title: Vidigal 2011 Reserva Red (Lisboa)

description: This Cabernet Sauvignon has aromas of black plum, violet and vanilla that pave the way for bright flavors of red plum and blackberry on the palate. The tannins are a bit chewy, but the long finish is rewarding.
title: Vini 2012 Veni Vidi Vici Cabernet Sauvignon (Thracian Valley)

description: This fruity wine is full of juicy red berries that are laced with acidity. Hints of wood aging stay in the background of this essentially fresh and bright wine.
title: Château les Mottes Pradier 2011  Côtes de Bourg

description: Stalky, short aromas suggest that this is raw and underripe. The palate feel confirms that impression; it's tight and choppy, with drying tannins. Roasted, gritty flavors of red fruits come with a sprinkle of cocoa, while the finish is tough in feel, spicy and ultimately mildly bitter.
title: CVNE 2008 Cune Reserva  (Rioja)

description: Orange marmalade and potpourri notes are accented by cocoa powder and toast tones. Silky tannins and even-keeled acids define the palate, which concludes with a reprise of the orange flavor.
title: Fiddlebender NV In Tune Red (Arizona)

description: Canned cranberry sauce and Indian spices collide on the nose. Light in color, it feels tad sweet once sipped, thanks to juicy flavors of strawberry and cherry.
title: Francis Ford Coppola 2012 Diamond Collection Pinot Noir (Monterey County)

description: High-toned lemon and toasted nut notes mark the nose. Medium in body, this has cutting acids, which kick the salivary glands into overdrive.
title: Page Springs 2010 Arizona Stronghold Vineyard Chardonnay (Cochise County)

description: A wine of medium weight and alcohol that tastes bigger on the palate due to the tannins. There's dullness to the fruit, which shows blackberry and cherry amidst a trace of clove before a hint of greenness on the finish.
title: Billhook 2011 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: Young Hunter Valley Sémillon is one of the most perplexing wines to evaluate, and I suspect that in 8–10 years' time, my rating will seem overly stingy. Still, this light-bodied wine appears to lack depth, complexity and length, offering just some odd, resiny scents and waxy, citrusy flavors.
title: Pepper Tree 2006 Reserve Semillon (Hunter Valley)

description: Rusty in color but natural, which is also this wine's downfall. It has no dosage, so what's left is leafy, herbal Pinot Noir aromas and flavors. It's peachy, drying and zesty, but also saddled with tomato leaf and rhubarb. Such is the life of Brut Nature rosé.
title: Maria Casanovas 2004 Brut Nature Pinot Noir (Cava)

description: There's a slightly awkward quality that recalls soda, aniseed, candied orange and peppermint powder. These elements make for an odd  but distinctive wine with pungent pineapple flavors in the mouth.
title: Ocone 2006 Falanghina (Taburno)

description: Springhill Cellars has been around for two decades, but this new release of the estate Pinot Noir is a bit of a disappointment. Light, sweet and simple, it turns a bit medicinal on the finish.
title: Springhill Cellars 2006 Estate Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: A candied nose of raspberry and pepper starts this wine out on a slightly clumsy note, but on the palate, the wine offers solid, if slightly simple, flavors. The finish impresses with its warm, spicy wave.
title: Keuka Spring 2006 Cabernet Sauvignon (Finger Lakes)

description: Overly sweet, this soft wine has flavors of sugared crushed cherries,   blackberries and raspberries, like high-class marmalade.
title: Leonesse Cellars 2005 Meritage (Temecula)

description: This is the kind of fun, flirty white that won't break the bank or your brain—it's simple and sippable. The nose offers pineapple, lemon and a touch of toast, while the fruit flavors are bright and appealing. Could use a touch of acidity but overall, the wine is balanced. A good everyday choice.
title: Lucas Vineyards NV Miss Chevious Nautie III White (New York)

description: With its ample body and complex touches of chocolate, plum and spice, this is clearly a serious attempt at rosé, just one that seems a bit tired at this stage of its evolution. Drink up.
title: Margan 2007 Saignée Rosé Shiraz (Hunter Valley)

description: Bramble and burning brush on the nose, while the palate is murky as it delivers tomato leaf, baked plum and carob flavors. Seems sort of cooked and funky, with a muddled mouthfeel. The 2005 is a cleaner, more focused wine.
title: Coto de Hayas 2006 Tempranillo-Cabernet Sauvignon (Campo de Borja)

description: Dill, cheese and mossy fruit give this wine a less than super bouquet. The palate is light, with strawberry flavors mixed with some peppery, herbal overtones. Short on the finish; not much bang for the buck.
title: Diez-Caballero 2001 Reserva  (Rioja)

description: Soft, rustic and slightly sweet, with jammy flavors of cherries, blackberries, pepper and smoky oak. Drink now.
title: French Hill 2006 Grand Reserve Cabernet Franc (California)

description: Almost volatile, but with reduced raisin below. If you are familiar with   hot-climate California Zinfandel, this is not unlike that. It has a vinegary attack and then a strange but limited sweetness lurking in the weeds. A   challenged wine.
title: Asensio 2003 Javier Asensio Tinto Red (Navarra)

description: This playful rosé is marked by a saccharine, cotton candy quality that will remind you of cherry cough drops or raspberry lollipop. It's a simple, no-fuss, beautifully packaged wine with a subtle touch of bitter astringency on the close.
title: Villa Mottura 2007 Negroamaro Rosé (Salento)

description: Meaty and very oaky, with resin, mocha and milky aromas that amount to a wood cutter's dream. Not surprisingly, the mouthfeel is more shocking and acidic than the oaky bouquet suggests; flavors are racy and tart, and then a bitter lactic quality comes on strong. Too much going on, with nothing pulling in the same direction.
title: Gladium 2005 Crianza Tempranillo (La Mancha)

description: This bone-dry blush has flavors of pepper, herb tea and baked cherry pie filling, and finishes very dry. It tastes a little tired, despite its young age.
title: Alma Rosa 2006 El Jabalí Vineyard Vin Gris Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: White flowers, honey and toasted spice lead on this Riesling from New York, and on the palate, a backbone of elegant fruit prevails. Paired with the wine's sweet touch, the flavors offer a simple, appealing quaff that will pair well with spicy cuisine.
title: Anthony Road 2007 Semi-Sweet Riesling (Finger Lakes)

description: Soft, sweet and simple in structure. Many wine lovers will enjoy the cherry, raspberry, vanilla and chocolate-cinnamon flavors that taste like a dessert pastry.
title: Arger-Martucci 2005 Syrah (Atlas Peak)

description: The name boasts of balance but we find mostly pine needle, skunk and eventually creamy red-fruit aromas followed by lean, tangy stawberry and cherry flavors. Light fruit and simple oak is all that's here.
title: Anta 2006 A4 Nuestro Equilibrio  (Ribera del Duero)

description: The wine's aromas are simple and rather monothematic and recall apple cider or pear juice. There's even a slight veil in its appearance and a gritty texture that further reinforces that pear juice impression. That said, Bisceglia is an up and coming modern winery and one worth keeping an eye on in the future.
title: Bisceglia 2006 Chardonnay (Basilicata)

description: An  everyday Chard, with superripe pear and apricot flavors and a thick coat of smoky oak.
title: Napa Family Vineyards 2005 Reserve Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: Tastes semisweet, like a lemon, lime and pineapple cough drop. But the acidity is brisk and cleansing, and lots of people will enjoy this affordable wine.
title: Hilltown 2006 Sauvignon Blanc (Monterey County)

description: This exotic white blend from Iowa offers aromas of orange and citrus with a minerally zip, and on the palate, is a bit on the sweet and curvy side. Not terribly inspired but still pretty, it will pair well with Asian cuisine.
title: Jasper NV Black Road White (Iowa)

description: An awkward Chard that tastes unnaturally oaky, with medicinal flavors of toasted, sweet vanilla bean. You'll find hints of pineapples and papayas, but that oaky thing is really strong.
title: Magistrate 2006 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)

description: The 2006 was really good, but the 2007 is a disappointment. Where that wine was complex, this is simple, tasting of watermelon, cotton candy and LifeSaver cherry flavors that finish watery and sugary.
title: Migration 2007 Vin Gris of Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

description: Very dark and seemingly on the cooked side of the ledger. The nose is black and raisiny, while the core flavors are saucy. At least this meaty, overdone Garnacha isn't oaked, so in that sense it isn't offensive. But it is definitely soft, and without much future.
title: Bodegas Agustín Cubero 2006 Viñas Viejas Garnacha (Calatayud)

description: A plucky nose of fruitcake and spice leads off. On the palate, good, robust red fruit, a solid, dry and minerally backbone and a touch of oak offer dimension and balance. A bit rough and ready, the wine will benefit from pairing with grilled meats or spicy dishes that can match its energy.
title: Casa Rondeña Winery 2006 Calvin Clarion Red (New Mexico)

description: Airén is a big-crop white grape that is usually distilled into brandy or made into Sherry. But here we see it as a dry white table wine, and while it is limited in scope, the wine's punch-bowl approach and cleansing lime and kiwi flavors are decent.
region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla
title: Sierra Virgen 2007 Airen (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)

description: Aromas recall sweet candy, bordering on cotton candy, with peppermint powder and aromatic flowers in the background. The nose is saccharine and synthetic and the wine is watery and easy in the mouth.
title: Statti 2006 Greco (Lamezia)

description: Lean, dry raspberry aromas and a slight floral essence carry the nose toward a zesty, semisharp palate with crisp cherry and cranberry flavors. Not bad in a lean, stripped-back way; but there's no excess oak, weight or sweetness. Lean stuff for old-school palates nursing plates of ham or salami.
title: Bodegas Leza García 2006 Arderius  (Rioja)

description: Pickle and sweet funk on the nose give this chunky wine a nose that's less than fresh. Flavors of orange, peach and cantaloupe are sweet but flat, and in the end it tastes more like a fruit juice than a really solid dry rosé.
title: Darien 2007 Rosado Tempranillo (Rioja)

description: Deep and dark in the glass, this bottling from a family-owned winery shows aromas of cola spice, wild cherry, cocoa dust and game. On the palate, rich black-cherry fruit is expertly cut by accents of dried sagebrush and licorice. Persistent, bountiful acidity carries it to a black raspberry-inflected finish.
title: Boekenoogen 2015 Estate Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Just two barrels of this Paul Hobbs-consulted wine were made, and that focus is evidenced by its soft and lavish vanilla, mace, cocoa, white pepper and lavender aromas and its core of cassis fruit. Luxurious tannins and underlying acidity carry measured blackberry and chocolate flavors.
title: Brave & Maiden 2014 Limited Syrah (Santa Ynez Valley)

description: This lightly sparkling, terroir-driven wine is loaded with soul and finesse. It's ethereal and bone dry, with delicately alluring aromas and flavors of white spring flower, ripe apple, Bartlett pear, citrus and Alpine herb. Crisp acidity and a silky mousse provide balance and finesse while a mineral note energizes the focused finish. The sediment at the bottom of the bottle adds even more flavor to the last glass.
title: Ca' dei Zago 2016 Col Fondo Glera

description: This perfumed and floral wine is concentrated and dense. Its ripe black-plum and spice flavors are impressive with their intensity. Produced from biodynamically grown grapes, the wine is showing considerable aging potential. Drink this wine from 2020.
title: Domaine Amirault 2014 Le Fondis  (Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil)

description: Burnt tea, forest floor and crushed leaf aromas ride atop dense layers of turned earth and stemmy rose scents in this intriguing wine from a beloved site. Moderate acidity keeps it fresh, highlighting its succulent black cherry fruit with lavender and Asian spice notes that emerge on the finish.
title: Siduri 2015 Keefer Ranch Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Made exclusively from Pinot Noir, this is a rich and highly textured wine. Red fruit aromas yield a ripe impression on the palate, while at the same time, it is dry and crisp in tangy acidity, with a zesty lemon flourish. This food-friendly wine is ready to drink.
designation: Grand Cru Brut Blanc de Noirs
title: Besserat de Bellefon NV Grand Cru Brut Blanc de Noirs Pinot Noir (Champagne)

description: The nose of this bottling is extremely focused on black raspberry and grapeseed, and its snappy dark fruit is tempered with agebrush, lavender and mace aromas. Firm and upright tannins frame the palate, where dark cranberry and clove flavors combine for layers of energy and depth.
title: Calera 2014 Mills Vineyard Pinot Noir (Mt. Harlan)

description: This is a dry-style Riesling, though it still lends a ripe, fruity impression. Lemon, lime and grapefruit are shuffled into a winning hand, with ample details of cilantro, fennel and wet stone. It's a vibrant, refreshing wine that is immensely food friendly.
title: Cave Spring 2015 Estate Riesling (Beamsville Bench)

description: Finely chopped herb notes, recalling marjoram, thyme and anise, combine with with dried rose and red cherry aromas on the delicately wild nose of this bottling. The palate adds forest floor flavors to its dark red fruit, making for a heady expression that grows in complexity sip after sip.
title: Chanin 2015 Sanford & Benedict Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: A fine blend of equal parts of Pinot Noir, Chardonnay and Pinot Meunier, this ripe wine is crisp with acidity and a nervy mineral texture. It is still young, still tight and structured. But it will be a fine wine as it matures. Drink from 2019.
title: Chanoine 2012 Tsarine Millésime Brut  (Champagne)

description: This blend of equal parts of Pinot Noir and Chardonnay is impressive. On the dry side of Brut, it is crisp, tight with intense acidity and a nervy texture that will soften. It's a perfumed, structured wine full of potential with its citrus and spice flavors. Drink this bottling from 2019.
title: Chanoine NV Tzarina No 1 Brut  (Champagne)

description: A mellow touch of ripe Red Delicious apple hovers on the nose. The palate brims with rich fruit, showing candied pear and dried apple. This richness is countered by a pleasantly bitter phenolic edge and a pure streak of fresh zestiness. A touch of sandalwood and cinnamon adds spice around the edges. While this is attractive now, it will reward cellaring as far more interesting notes of spice and fruit are sure to develop. Drink 2020–2030.
title: Domaine Charles Frey 2015 Frankstein Grand Cru Vendanges Tardives Pinot Gris (Alsace)

description: Once again, this more affordable “younger brother” to the Mount Eden bottling competes with gusto. Including 14% Merlot, 6% Cabernet Franc, 4% Petit Verdot and 1% Malbec, it shows savory black plum, black pepper, char, leather and dried herb aromas on the nose. The palate is hearty and almost salty tasting, with beef, charred black fruit, pine resin and caramel flavors. Very satisfying and full of umami characteristics.
title: Domaine Eden 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: A rich floral notion of dandelion precedes the rich aroma of ripe peaches on the nose. The palate opens into a kind of vast peach mellowness, edged with a touch of citrus zest and a grounding, earthy element. A gentle sweetness boosts the peachy roundedness but does not dominate. This is gentle on the surface but very concentrated at the core. It is on the off-dry finish that the lemon zest comes though triumphantly. Drink 2017–2027.
title: Domaine Michel Fonne 2012 Marckrain Grand Cru Gewurztraminer (Alsace)

description: Lovely structure amplifies all the best qualities of this estate-grown wine. A tight core of pear, lemon and tangerine fruit sets up a long finish. The acidity is clean and in perfect proportion, with no chalkiness. Drink now through 2027.
title: Domaine Serene 2015 Clos du Soleil Vineyard Chardonnay (Dundee Hills)

description: Ripe berry aromas are touched up with cola and root-beer notes that make this even nicer. A muscular, deeply structured palate is home to herbal plum and berry flavors along with notes of coffee and dark spices. Tobacco and herbal notes take over on a complex finish. Drink this Cabernet Franc (with 15% Malbec) through 2024.
title: El Enemigo 2014 Gran Enemigo Agrelo Single Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Mendoza)

description: Notions of tart redcurrant play on the nose while a delicious edge of white pepper draws you in. The same pepper entices on the palate, framing fresh, tart berry and lemon purity on the slender but memorable palate. A firm structure makes this spicy, energetic and invigorating little number irresistible. The fine mousse has verve and elegance. It finishes pure and long.
title: Exton Park Vineyard NV Rosé Sparkling (England)

description: The nose of this bottling from the former Addamo Vineyard is full of underbrush and sage notes, with complex layers of candied raspberry, wisteria and cinnamon stick aromas. Juicy raspberry and pomegranate flavors kick off the palate, where allspice, nutmeg, dried ginger and flowering thyme notes coalesce.
title: Grevino 2014 Estate Vineyards Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)

description: A generously ripe touch of apricot hovers before blending in with ripe Amalfi lemon and Granny Smith notes. Brightness and light seem to be at the core of this wine. The mousse is exuberant and flavors are brisk and urgent. Subtle autolysis provides a calm backdrop to all the lively, fruity action in the foreground. The balance is harmonious and flavors are brisk, fruity and pure The long-lasting finish conveys seriousness. Lovely now, the wine will evolve with bottle age. Drink 2017–2022.
title: Gusbourne Estate 2013 Brut Reserve Sparkling (England)

description: This wine is predominately Cabernet Sauvignon, with smaller amounts of other Bordeaux red varieties. Together, they offer bold, ripe red-currant and -berry flavors, with a rich entry and gravelly texture. Highly stylized, grippy tannins and a leather note provide additional strength.
title: Joseph Phelps 2014 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: This top-tier bottling from Steve Martell, which blends 62% Grenache with 29% Syrah, 5% Mourvèdre and 4% Petite Sirah, offers roasted coffee, charred black currant, burnt wood and baked earth aromas. The palate is tight and bright with flashy boysenberry and black raspberry flavors balanced by anise and sagebrush accents.
title: Kaleidos 2015 Praying Mantis Red (Paso Robles)

description: With some age, this bone-dry wine has softened and filled out. There's still a lemon aroma as well as crisp acidity on the palate, but they are less tight now, rounded and with a fine balance between fruit and acidity. It is still a year off maturity, so wait until 2018.
title: Lombard et Cie 2008 Brut Nature Grand Cru Millésime  (Champagne)

description: This is a round, rich wine full of fig, vanilla and salty oak flavors. Bright, lemony freshness and a stony, mineral-like quality accentuate its texture and complexity, lasting long into the finish.
title: Lynmar 2015 Susanna's Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)

description: Citrus, apple, crushed herb and wild flower aromas take center stage on this elegant sparkler. It's bright and silky, with savory Bartlett pear, nectarine zest and hints of thyme balanced by a creamy mousse and vibrant acidity. Thanks to its depth of flavors, finesse and crisp dry finish, it beautifully demonstrates Prosecco's serious side.
designation: Vigneto della Riva di San Floriano Brut
title: Nino Franco 2016 Vigneto della Riva di San Floriano Brut  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

description: Delicately sparkling, this creamy Champagne is crisp, fruity and on the dry side of Brut. It has citrus as well as pear flavors giving a fruity edge to the lively texture. This delicious wine should age a little longer, so drink from 2019.
designation: Nuit Blanche Blanc de Blancs Grand Cru Brut
title: Petit & Bajan 2011 Nuit Blanche Blanc de Blancs Grand Cru Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)

description: This wine comes from a parcel that is planted at a superhigh density of nearly 7,000 plants per acre. This gives the plants greater competition between each other and encourages concentration of the wine. That is true in this rich wine with its impeccable balance between white fruit and mineral texture from the chalk soil. The wine will age, so drink from 2020.
title: Château de Tracy 2014 Haute Densité  (Pouilly-Fumé)

description: From one of the top of the new generation of Vouvray estates, this wine is a delicious medley of fruit flavors. With a touch of honey to go with the apple, and citrus to give extra freshness, this is a beautiful wine. It is very drinkable although still so young. Drink now if you can't wait, but it's better to hold on until 2021.
title: Domaine Vincent Carême 2015 Le Peu Morier  (Vouvray)

description: Here's a smooth, delicious Prosecco that will satisfy both the novice and the sophisticated wine lover. It opens with lovely aromas of pressed wild flower, apple and a whiff of pastry dough that follow through to the palate along with pear, tangerine zest and a hint of almond. An elegant mousse and crisp acidity offset the creamy flavors. It has lingering bone-dry finish.
title: Mongarda 2013 Dosaggio Zero  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

description: Beautiful, bright boysenberry and blackberry aromas meet fennel and pepper scents on the nose of this blend of 64% Grenache and 36% Syrah, which is sold primarily through the winery's Santa Clarita Valley tasting room. A lavish tannic profile decorates the lush palate, where black currant jam, licorice and clove flavors fight for attention.
title: Pulchella 2014 Highs & Lows Red (Paso Robles)

description: A wonderfully aromatic nose of blossom and Conference pear is very appetizing. The palate comes in with pear-fruited generosity and an almost oily mouthfeel that speaks of the power of this concentrated wine. There is a pleasant edge of pithy bitterness that acts as a counterpoint to the inherent richness and ripeness of the fruit alongside fresh acidity. This is balanced and rounded and just off dry with a lovely, fresh structure that echoes long. There is great aging potential here. Drink 2017–2030.
designation: Clos Saint Landelin Vorbourg Grand Cru
title: René Muré 2015 Clos Saint Landelin Vorbourg Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

description: Simple, clean, fresh, raspberry-flavored wine, with light acidity. There is an edge of apple and caramel, the aftertaste just off dry.
title: Yvon Mau 2008 Seigneurs de Bergerac Rosé (Bergerac)

description: Light, watery and thin, with simple lemon and green apple flavors, and plenty of acidity.
title: Gilbert Cellars 2008 Unoaked Chardonnay (Wahluke Slope)

description: Rugged, rustic and dry, with briary flavors of wild berries, raisins, cocoa, pepper, leather and herbs. Ready now with easy fare.
title: McManis 2008 Zinfandel (California)

description: Very dry and rather sharp in acidity, this Syrah offers cherry-berry flavors with a hint of herbs and spices. It turns bitter on the finish. Good price, but could use greater richness.
title: Big House 2007 The Slammer Syrah (Santa Barbara County)

description: A simple Chardonnay, with likeable pineapple, apple, lime, kiwi and vanilla flavors. Finishes sweet. Seems pricey for what you get.
title: Calcareous 2008 Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: A simple, rugged wine with flavors of berries, chocolate, herbs and something vaguely oak-like. It's dry and full-bodied.
title: McManis 2008 Syrah (California)

description: An everyday Zin, soft and candied, with blackberry, cherry, licorice and cocoa flavors. The tannin structure is rich. Drink now.
title: Leaping Lizard 2007 Zinfandel (Sonoma County)

description: An okay red wine. It's soft, dry and common in structure, with thin flavors of blackberries, spices and a touch of oak.
title: Adler Fels 2006 Cabernet Sauvignon (Russian River Valley)

description: Dull and herbal, with modest berry and spice flavors. The structure is soft and simple. Disappointing.
title: Chateau Montelena 2006 Estate Zinfandel (Napa Valley)

description: This has a rather noticeable candy cane scent, leading into a beery, yeasty, flat-feeling wine.
title: Matthews Estate 2008 Stillwater Creek Sauvignon Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Crisp acidity saves this rather sweet, oaky wine by giving it a clean mouthfeel. The flavors are of pineapple and apple juice, honey and vanilla caramel.
title: Wild Horse 2008 Chardonnay (Central Coast)

description: Tastes raw and overripe, with raisiny flavors. The raisin skin tannins accentuate the grape tannins, leading to a hard, astringently dry finish.
title: Midnight 2007 Aquarius Pinot Noir (Paso Robles)

description: Lots of exotic citrus, peach and tropical fruit flavors in this crisply clean blend, but it's really too sweet to qualify as a dry table wine. Tastes more like something you'd have for dessert.
title: Midnight 2008 Aurora Reserve White (Paso Robles)

description: Vanilla, pear and a whiff of wintergreen make the nose intriguing, but after that it's commercial mango and pineapple flavors with a pithy finish. A sweet, overpumped Chardonnay.
title: Santa Alicia 2009 Reserva Chardonnay (Maipo Valley)

description: Slightly sweet, with simple apple and mango juice flavors and a veneer of oak-like vanillins and caramel. Crisp acidity helps to make the finish clean.
title: Souverain 2008 Chardonnay (Alexander Valley)

description: Too soft in acidity, so the blackberry, currant, cherry liqueur and spice flavors have a curious jamminess. The softness and high alcohol emphasize sweetness, affecting the finish.
title: Adelaida 2007 Michael's Estate Vineyard Zinfandel (Paso Robles)

description: Soft, almost sweet, with considerable caramel and sweet strawberry flavors. There is an awkward final bitterness.
title: Château Bélingard 2008 Rosé (Bergerac)

description: Thin in berry fruit and tannic, this rustic wine shows its high alcohol with a chili pepper burn through the finish. The flavors aren't rich enough for balance.
title: Eagle Castle 2007 Royal Red Red (Paso Robles)

description: Very dry and raisiny-pruney, a harsh, somewhat bitter wine. The dryness is relieved by some ripely sweet blackberries that show up in the middle palate.
title: Fenestra 2007 Silvaspoons Vineyard Malbec (Lodi)

description: Too green and acidic to earn a higher score, although it's pleasantly dry and clean, and there are some savory citrus flavors. But they're dominated by tart leafy tobacco and feline notes.
title: Frei Brothers 2008 Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)

description: This cuvée has a steely quality. The fruit hits solidly on raspberry, with a nice tang to the acids. It's still tight, focused and young, suggesting that further bottle age will lead to further improvement. It has a light touch of caramel in the finish.
title: Alexana 2015 Fennwood Vineyard Pinot Noir

description: This wine presents an interesting mix of herbal, citrus and stone-fruit components. Lemon pepper and grapefruit, with a touch of Satsuma orange, all stand out. A slick lick of caramel carries on the finish.
title: Argyle 2015 Grower Series Chardonnay (Willamette Valley)

description: Intense aromas of inky, leathery black fruits announce a full, saturated palate that's bolstered by tartaric acidity. Plum, blackberry, raw oak and salty flavors are chocolaty on a finish. Drink through 2019.
title: Baica 2015 Barricado Organic Monastrell (Jumilla)

description: Oaky, concentrated black-fruit aromas feature notes of graphite and savory earth. This Monastrell is deep, jammy and textured on a full-bodied palate. Spicy oak and black-plum flavors finish toasty, with hints of baking spices and dried herbs. Drink through 2019.
title: Baica 2015 La Finca Selección Monastrell Monastrell (Jumilla)

description: Aromas of pressed honeysuckle and orchard fruit lead the nose while the vibrant savory palate doles out ripe peach, yellow apple and a hint of lemon zest. An almond note lends a pleasantly bitter finish.
title: Balestri Valda 2014 Vigneto Sengialta  (Soave Classico)

description: This voluptuous wine offers concentrated golden honey, baked apricot and pear notes, with integrated oak. Made in a full-bodied, creamy style that's hard to resist, it has a looming acidity that works behind the scenes to provide balance.
title: Belden Barns 2015 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Sonoma Mountain)

description: Nutty aromas are rich and oily in this semisweet amontillado. It is round and chewy on the palate, with a layering of creamy, nutty flavors: Toffee, chocolate and caramel. These notes linger on the unwavering finish.
title: Bodegas Dios Baco S.L. NV Élite Amontillado Selection Medium Sherry (Jerez)

description: This intensely ripe wine is made predominantly from Cabernet Sauvignon, with smaller amounts of Malbec and Merlot. Its waxy cherry, currant and blueberry flavers are laced wtih milk chocolate and smoky oak richness, a dash of high-toned acidity sparking on the finish.
title: Buena Vista 2014 The Founder Red (Sonoma County)

description: On the nose, this smells a touch yeasty and bready, similar to Saltine crackers. The mouthfeel on this sparkling wine is crisp and right on. Slightly bitter white-fruit flavors come with a dusting of white pepper and a lingering lime note on the dry finish.
title: Castellroig 2011 Gran Reserva Brut Nature Sparkling (Cava)

description: This single-vineyard wine offers high-toned citrus, almond and vanilla bean flavors. Fresh and fruity, it's light  bodied yet doesn't skimp on flavor or texture, finishing on a tart note of lemon pith.
title: Conclusion 2015 Morgaen Lee Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)

description: This wine utilizes 40% neutral oak, 40% stainless steel and 20% new French barrels, and is fermented with native yeast. It's a deep, vibrant gold color, sporting sexy aromas of pineapple, pear and peach. The palate is fully ripe, round and forward, with luscious fruit flavors throughout.
title: DanCin 2016 Mélange Chardonnay (Southern Oregon)

description: This elegant wine puts flavors of apple and citrus with floral highlights into the mix. It gains strength in midpalate, finishing strong with cinnamon, paprika and white pepper.
title: Provincial Vineyards 2015 Estate Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

description: Aromas of citrus blossom, white stone fruit and a whiff of wet flint float from the glass. Fresh and savory, the juicy palate delivers ripe Bartlett pear, yellow apple, nectarine and lemon drop alongside bright acidity. Notes of almond and ginger add depth.
title: Ronco del Gelso 2015 Rive Alte Pinot Grigio (Friuli Isonzo)

description: This wine's thick and buttery aromas range from cashew cream and caramel to honeysuckle and Maui onion. Its powerful acidity cuts through the palate's unctuous and oily qualities, with buttercream and lemon juice flavors combining for a big personality.
title: Scott Family 2015 Dijon Clone Chardonnay (Arroyo Seco)

description: Smoky bark and cola notes are cradled in reductive oak in this robust wine from a fantastically farmed site. Its dark berry flavor is supported by velvety tannin and juicy acidity, both of which provide moderate structure.
title: Sonoma-Loeb 2015 Dutton Ranch Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Perfumed with rose and lavender, this wine has robust tannins and dominant oak notes, both in support of its ripe, concentrated red fruit. Woody, herbal components complement the lushness, framed by gravelly texture.
title: Trione 2014 River Road Ranch Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: This is 100% Pommard clone, bright and spicy in the nose. The fruit flavors are sharp and penetrating, with brambly berries and a touch of pine sap.
title: Van Duzer 2014 Homestead Block Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Floral berry, olive and spice aromas make for a rustic nose with polish. This wine feels lively and a bit jumpy, with woody plum and berry flavors that are braced and framed by crisp Patagonian acidity. A lightly herbal, salty finish is powerful but steady. Drink through 2020.
title: Verum 2016 Reserva Cabernet Franc (Alto Valle del Río Negro)

description: Beautifully aromatic notes of ripe apple make for a most appetizing nose. The soft fizz on the palate underlines both the fruity apple purity and the bready backdrop of autolysis. A very harmonious refreshing wine that is dry, utterly light and moreish.
title: Jean-Baptiste Adam NV Les Natures Sparkling (Crémant d'Alsace)

description: Plum, dark berries and a slick streak of almond paste combine in this supple wine. It has a touch of dried herb and soft leather, with light tannins wrapping up the finish.
title: Lange 2014 Lange Estate Vineyard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: This tight, focused wine offers strawberry and raspberry fruit, aged in one-third new French oak. The oak is barely evident, but the fruit-centric wine shows good structure and medium concentration.
title: Lange 2014 Yamhill-Carlton Assemblage Pinot Noir

description: This 100% varietal wine is decidedly savory and herbal—a full-bodied expression of tomato leaf and tobacco, bursting with mushroom and forest floor notes. Leather and black pepper flavors enter the fray midway through, carried forward by firm tannins and fresh, lingering acidity.
title: Lobo 2014 Wulff Vineyards Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: Only recently disgorged in July 2017, this bottling is still young. It is structured with a hint of tannin as well as a steely tight texture. It is going to develop into a fine wine, rich and with a blend of apple and ripe pear flavors. Drink this bottling from late 2018.
designation: Brut Nature Premier Cru Blanc de Noirs
title: Lombard et Cie NV Brut Nature Premier Cru Blanc de Noirs Pinot Noir (Champagne)

description: Ripe aromas of cassis, prune and brandied black cherry indicate the concentration on this Cabernet. A palate that doesn't hold back is jammy but a bit heavy. Ripe berry, toast and charred flavors take on a chocolaty note on the finish. This wine is all about full extraction and big fruit. Drink through 2022.
title: Mendel 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)

description: Subdued cranberry, crushed rose petal, lavender and sweet sage notes show on the nose of this clonal mash-up. Tightly wound cranberry and red plum skin flavors show on the palate, brushed with anise and a hint of white pepper. This will probably be much more complex in the years to come.
title: Morgan 2015 Twelve Clones Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: David Potter continues to lead the way for underused varieties, and this bottling shows why more should bravely walk that path. Fresh-pressed plum, underripe strawberry, fennel and licorice aromas lead into a palate full of Christmas spice and plum sauce flavors. Although not incredibly complex, it's unique, fun and perfect for a sunny day.
title: Municipal Winemakers 2014 Cinsault (Santa Barbara County)

description: Light in color, this wine has an exotic nose of dried herb, forest floor and wild mushroom scents. Tart, nervy acidity accents its rhubarb and cranberry flavors as a sprinkling of white pepper teases.
title: Papapietro Perry 2014 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: Fleshy and briny, this wine hails from the producer's own marquee vineyard, situated in the heart of the Olivet Lane district. Ripe, with a buttery undertone, it's classic in its rendering of Gravenstein apple and pear flavors—balanced, yet with a robust frame.
title: Pellegrini 2014 Olivet Lane Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)

description: The wine has a lively mousse along with crisp acidity. Unusually for a rosé, the blend is 90% Chardonnay, the color coming from the addition of red wine (normal in Champagne). It shows some maturity with a hint of toastiness as well as a soft aftertaste on the sweet side of Brut. Drink now.
title: Petit & Bajan NV Nymphéa Brut Rosé Grand Cru  (Champagne)

description: This new cuvée blends fruit from three of the estate vineyards—Mark Bradford, Grace and Côte Sud. It's medium bodied, with a mix of dried cherries, chocolate and herb. Somehow those flavors don't quite knit together. The wine feels a bit unfocused, though all the components are individually fine. It would be worth waiting until 2018 or 2019 before pulling the cork on this one.
title: Domaine Serene 2014 Aspect Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: Madonna del Piano Riserva's rich elements of barbecue smoke and spice add background nuances to black fruit and mature cherry. But what really sets this Brunello apart is the smoothness of its silky texture.
title: Valdicava 2005 Madonna del Piano Riserva  (Brunello di Montalcino)

description: Bright spice, tobacco and leather make for a warm, brooding personality that characterizes Mocali's gorgeous Brunello. But the fruit is by no means missing. In fact, loads of cherry and blueberry help to liven the wine's densely extracted mouthfeel.
title: Mocali 2006  Brunello di Montalcino

description: The wine shows both rich density and structure. It gives weight while remaining stylish. The delicious black berry fruits on the finish characterize a wine that is classic, balancing fruit and tannins.
title: Château Canon la Gaffelière 2008  Saint-Émilion

description: While at this young stage there may be toasty aromas, there is also intense, perfumed fruit. This complex, distinguished wine is polished, with plenty of bright fruits and acidity.
title: Château Haut-Bailly 2008  Pessac-Léognan

description: Treated now as a separate wine, rather than a second wine, with its own vineyard, Clos du Marquis has developed a dense, concentrated style. It is firm, chewy, the tannins in suspension in the rich fruit. Good aging potential.
title: Château Léoville Las Cases 2008 Clos du Marquis  (Saint-Julien)

description: This beautiful Riserva Brunello is characterized by very good balance, enduring sensations of richness and aromatic generosity. The wine's natural density and bright berry flavors carry forth over the long finish.
title: Donatella Cinelli Colombini 2005 Riserva  (Brunello di Montalcino)

description: A beautiful Pinot Noir. It's so light bodied, so silky in the mouth, that the richness comes as a surprise. Endless waves of raspberry and cherry purée, gingersnap cookie, buttered cinnamon toast, vanilla and sandalwood. Just a delight to drink, and should develop slowly over the next 6–8 years.
title: Freeman 2008 Akiko's Cuvée Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: Rich and elaborate, a crowd pleaser to satisfy just about any Cabernet lover. Although it's potent in classic blackberry and cassis flavors, it shows a dryness and balance that you could call Bordeaux-style. Should develop easily for a decade in the cellar.
title: Joel Gott 2008 Cabernet Sauvignon (Stags Leap District)

description: Italians use the word “piacione” to describe a wine with irresistible intensity, softness and complexity. This is a piacione, or super-pleasurable wine, in the most positive meaning of the word. It shows loads of depth, personality and endurance. You'll love the vanilla chocolate and bright cherry finish.
title: La Fortuna 2006  Brunello di Montalcino

description: The Russian River Valley makes some of the state's greatest Sauvignon Blancs, in the right hands, and when those hands are Merry Edwards', you can be sure of what you're getting. The wine is dry and crisp in mouthwatering acidity, with citrus and lemongrass flavors that have richer tones of tropical fruits. It feels vibrant, elegant and complex in the mouth, a wine to savor over multiple glasses.
title: Merry Edwards 2009 Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)

description: This is a great wine, from a vintage that wasn't great. The nose is smooth and rich, with raspberry, plum, fine oak and all the spice that comes with it. The palate feels fresh and healthy, with racy blackberry fruit tempered by creamy chocolate, vanilla and spice. Like most high-end wines from the Eguren family, this is right on the money. Drink now through 2018.
title: Viñedos de Paganos 2008 La Nieta  (Rioja)

description: Poggio Antico consistently delivers standout Brunello, and this expression from the 2006 vintage is no exception. The wine is plush and rich with deliciously soft succulence. In the background, it delivers loads of vanilla, sweet spice, clove and black cherry.
title: Poggio Antico 2006  Brunello di Montalcino

description: This is a dark, smooth and rich Riserva Brunello with a spot of sweet succulence and ripe cherry at the midpalate. The wine offers long, smooth texture and a clean, persistent mouthfeel.
title: Poggio di Sotto 2005 Riserva  (Brunello di Montalcino)

description: This formal, upright wine has solid, dense tannins and is well structured: with acidity and firm fruit, it shows its more opulent side slowly, leading to a smoky finish.
title: Château Beau-Séjour Bécot 2008  Saint-Émilion

description: A powerful, chocolate- and berry fruit-flavored wine, powered by ripe tannins and juicy acidity. It has a solid foundation of tannins, on which is built a rich edifice of fruit.
title: Château la Fleur-Pétrus 2008  Pomerol

description: Here's an austere and sophisticated wine with dark notes of carob, exotic spice, cardamom pod, mesquite smoke and blackberry. The wine is soft, plush and chewy with firm tannins (that could use more time to soften) and a playful touch of acidity on the close.
title: Corte Pavone 2006  Brunello di Montalcino

description: Almost indistinguishable from a Premier Cru Beaune Burgundy, this Pinot, with alcohol of only 14.1%, is light in body, silky and dry. In the mouth, it shows a firm minerality, with cherry tart and spice flavors. A polished, subtle wine that should age well over the next ten years.
title: Kokomo 2008 Peters Vineyard Winemakers Reserve Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: This inky, dense Brunello delivers rich opulence and velvety cherry-berry nuances. Cassis, ripe raspberries and currants are followed by dark chocolate and exotic spice. The wine shows great balance too, especially between acidity and tannin.
title: La Mannella 2006  Brunello di Montalcino

description: With its classic mineral edge, dusty tannins and firm, dry structure, the wine has a core that weighs well with the severe texture. As a contrast, the fruit underneath is ripe and juicy. A wine for several years' aging.
title: Les Astéries 2008  Saint-Émilion

description: Argiano's Suolo is a true standout in the world of Tuscan Sangiovese. It achieves elegance, complexity and richness with bright cherry notes contrasted against sweet vanilla and spicy oak. The finish is long, smooth and persistent.
title: Argiano 2006 Suolo Sangiovese (Toscana)

description: This is a seriously beautiful Chianti Classico characterized by impressive elegance and a smooth, long feel that lasts many long minutes on the palate. The nose is equally pristine with bright but integrated aromas of dark fruit, spice and polished river stone.
title: Castello di Ama 2006  Chianti Classico

description: This textbook Brunello boasts a careful balance of elements. Sweet cherry and vanilla aromas segue to austere notes of exotic spice, cola and waxed leather. This is a tempered but elegant wine that would match savory duck with wild rice.
title: Pinino 2006  Brunello di Montalcino

description: A blend of Fernão Pires and Arinto, this is totally crisp and refreshingly fruity. It is perfumed, smooth while also cut with acidity. The acidity comes from both citrus and pineapple flavors. Drink now.
title: Falua 2015 Conde Vimioso Colheita Seleccionada Branco White (Tejo)

description: Aromas of citrus and petrol are backed by a juicy palate with tangy acidity and semisharp flavors of peach, tangerine and stone-fruit pits. Fresh, citrusy length and a lingering note of orange are the finish.
title: Finca Sophenia 2015 Altosur Sauvignon Blanc (Tupungato)

description: Known in Spain as Graciano, this grape produces attractive, fruity wine especially in the Tejo region. This example is ripe with layers of acidity as well as a generous texture. Soft and smooth, it is ready to drink.
title: Fiuza 2015 Red (Tejo)

description: This crisp, tangy wine is packed with citrus flavors. Brightly textured with a mineral edge, it is fruity, hinting at spice along with a floral, fresh character.
title: Georges Duboeuf 2014 Domaine des Chenevières  (Mâcon-Villages)

description: A rose garden's worth of aromas lift out of the glass in this hearty, full-bodied red, the peppery tannins somewhat grippy on the palate before settling down. Blackberry punches through on the palate, given additional color and lift from the 5% Petit Verdot.
title: Gibbs 2013 Carpenter Vineyard Cabernet Franc (St. Helena)

description: Almost caramel in color, this wine offers aromas of lemon zest and vanilla bean. Grippy tannins provide a firm backdrop to flavors of lemon, clementine, green apple and caramel. On its own, it may seem too chalky for some drinkers, but enjoying it alongside nuts and hard cheese will put the balance into focus.
title: Gotsa Family Wines 2013 Babaneuri Valley Mtsvane

description: A mild concentration of cherry, green herb, spice and rose petals mark the nose. Softly grained tannins offer just enough grip to this medium-bodied wine, with high-toned cherry and cranberry leading the flavors.
title: James Charles 2014 Arrivato 1913 Ameritage Red (Virginia)

description: With 12 months of oak aging, this is a ripe smoothly textured wine. It has black fruits, rich tannins and a jammy, generous texture. The wine is fruity and will be ready to drink from 2017.
title: Adega Cooperativa de Borba 2014 Montes Claros Reserva Red (Alentejo)

description: Funky aromas of game, powdered herb and scorched soil lead the nose. The tightly wound palate isn't very expressive, but eventually shows raw cherry, thyme and a hint of star anise while astringent tannins leave a rough, mouth drying finish.
title: Ascheri 2012 Sorano  (Barolo)

description: Get past the meaty aromas and the wine is smooth, caramel and spice flavored. The wood flavors are prominent suggesting the wine has been aged well. At the end, berry fruits and acidity come through.
title: Borges NV Porto Tawny Reserve  (Port)

description: The wine is all about fresh fruit. Blackberry fruit jumps from the glass with its light tannins and lively acidity. The structure, with just a touch of dryness, is just right to support the boisterous fruit. Drink from 2017.
title: Casca Wines 2015 Cascas Winemaker Selection Red (Alentejano)

description: From a region well-known for its sparkling wines, this is a fruity wine with soft acidity and a ripe apple character. It has a light mousse, creamy rather than crisp. Drink now.
title: Caves da Montanha 2009 Grande Cuvée Chardonnay-Arinto Sparkling (Bairrada)

description: Scents and flavors suggest cherry pipe tobacco, along with streaks of dried leaf and lemon oil. It's a rough and tumble, every day red, with some chewy tannins.
title: Cliff Creek 2012 Cabernet Sauvignon (Southern Oregon)

description: Finished quite dry, this brings tart rhubarb and sour berry fruit to bear, backed with ample acidity. It was whole cluster pressed, blended with Pinot Noir saignée, and cold fermented in stainless steel. It's a good picnic rosé, ready for cured meats and soft cheeses.
title: Coelho 2015 Divertimento Estate Vineyard Pinot Noir Rosé (Willamette Valley)

description: Lightly earthy flavors of dried raspberries have a chunky, almost rustic character, with a bass note of wet cement. It's a serviceable wine, solid and short, with none of the elegance of the finer Pinots.
title: Hawks View 2014 Hawks View Vineyard Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)

description: The scents of toasted brioche and vanilla reflect the fact that half of the wine was barrel fermented. As a result, it's got some weight and texture to it, but the fruit, outside a dash of pineapple, is relatively muted.
title: Innocent Bystander 2014 Pinot Gris (Victoria)

description: This wine is still young and developing. It is beginning to show its richer lemon and apple flavors, but it still needs more time. Wait until 2017.
title: Jean-Claude Debeaune 2014  Saint-Véran

description: From outlying vineyards in the Côte d'Or, the heartland of Burgundy, this wood-aged wine is full of red currants and attractive, easy acidity. With a touch of spice and a juicy aftertaste, it is ready to drink.
title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2014  Bourgogne

description: Baked and stewy on the nose, this Malbec-led blend is oaky and gives off a hickory scent. Chewy and rugged in feel, this tastes of roasted, herbal berry fruits, burnt meat and campfire creosote. Forced oak on the finish results in a strong sense of clove.
designation: Terroir Series Malbec Bonarda Petite Verdot
title: Kaiken 2014 Terroir Series Malbec Bonarda Petite Verdot Red (Mendoza)

description: Pressed apple and dusty mineral notes scent the nose of this subdued slightly savory Riesling. Juicy tangerine and Meyer lemon flavors lend sweetness to the midpalate. The moderately long finish is accented by dustings of pollen and saffron.
title: Leonard Kreusch 2015 Bernkasteler Kurfürstlay Spätlese Riesling (Mosel)

description: Ripe and fruity, this wine offers crisp apples and pear-juice flavors. It has a strongly tangy element that is refreshing and delicious now.
title: Louis Max 2014 Vieilles Vignes  (Pouilly-Fuissé)

description: Golden in color, this Petit Manseng (with 10% Seyval Blanc) underwent carbonic maceration, giving it punchy notes of lemon, grapefruit and pineapple rind on the nose and palate. Rich in feel, almost to the point of being flabby, there's just enough acid to maintain balance.
title: Lovingston 2014 Petit Manseng (Monticello)

description: Fresh and vibrant, this Cinsault bottling is completely oak-free, which means that the juicy, fruit-forward nature of the varietal is front and center. Ultraripe blueberry and raspberry notes mingle with specks of black pepper on the soft and mildly grippy palate. The is light bodied and easily quaffable.
title: McPherson 2014 Cinsault (Texas)

description: This is unusually pale, with a suggestion of a tawny, slightly oxidized hue. The soft entry brings dusty spices and tart cherry fruit. It finishes with some darker, slightly charred tones, and a hint of cigar. Drink up.
title: Dion 2014 Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)

description: This wine is crisp and fruity. It has attractive acidity, a nice touch of spice and a backbone of minerality. The juiciness leaves a bright, crisp aftertaste.
title: Domaine Ferret 2014  Pouilly-Fuissé

description: Saucy, stewy plum and licorice aromas lead to a wiry palate with grabby tannins. Lightly herbal berry flavors come with a shading of oak, while the finish is herbal and minty tasting, with a sense of raw freshness stemming from latent acidity.
title: El Solar de Orfila 2013 Malbec (Mendoza)

description: This sparkling blend of Chardonnay and Pinot Noir has the faintest touch of blush color. On the nose, it offers grapefruit and lemon. Bubbles are not very persistent, lasting just moments after the glass is poured. It has flavors of tart Granny Smith apple, brioche and lemon peel and a zippy finish.
title: Golan Heights Winery 2010 Yarden Rosé Brut Sparkling (Galilee)

description: Charred blackberries and deep caramel notes make up the nose of this wine named after the cellar master. Medium in feel, the palate shows a decent roundness, however racing acids cut the midpalate short. Additional black fruit carry the flavors, with black pepper marking the finish.
title: Veritas 2013 Paul Shaffer 5th Edition Petit Verdot (Monticello)

description: From the area known as Pierres Dorées because of the gold-colored stone used in buildings, this wine is soft and fruity. It carries a touch of tannin along with red-cherry crispness. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Vignerons des Pierres Dorées 2015 Salamandre d'Or  (Coteaux Bourguignons)

description: A bramble patch of aromas and flavors comes to mind in this blend of Malbec, Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc and Merlot: spicy raspberry, blackberry and green stems are prominent. The palate is silky and round in feel, with soft tannins melding against a veil of vanilla and butter.
title: Winery at La Grange 2013 Meritage (Virginia)

description: Red and black berries bring out the richness of the year, masking the seriously tannic structure. The wine has great spice, richness and a dark, smoky core of powerful tannins. For long-term aging, but delicious now.
title: Quinta do Vesuvio 2011 Vintage  (Port)

description: A powerfully dense wine, solidly based on dry tannins and rich black fruit. Structure, fruit and acidity all come together in a wine that shows immense potential as well as a softer side now.
title: Dow's 2011 Vintage  (Port)

description: Gorgeous, amplified aromas of wild berry, plum and fine herbs are crystal clear and magnetic. This beautiful Priorat is layered, smooth as glass and exemplary in every way. Flavors of mixed black fruits, cocoa, toast and schisty mineral finish in a swirl of chocolate, blackened toast, licorice and peppercorn. Best from 2015–2018.
title: Clos Mogador 2010 Red (Priorat)

description: A powerful, concentrated wine, full of dark tannins, ripe fruit and rich texture. This is a wine based on a solid structure—very firm in character while still allowing the gorgeous fruits to express themselves. It's obviously destined for long-term aging.
title: Quinta do Noval 2011 Vintage  (Port)

description: This is a very dry, firm wine that's solidly tannic but never harsh. The wine combines weight and ripe black fruit in a powerful expression of dense vintage Port from this estate in the Upper Douro. Acidity shines through the density on the finish. Age for many decades.
title: Quinta do Vale Meão 2011 Vintage  (Port)

description: A hugely dense wine, with immense ripe black fruit and dusty tannins. The wine is balanced, rich and structured at the same time. Powered by a dark core, the wine has weight, intensity and a solid long-term future.
title: Barão de Vilar 2011 Vintage  (Port)

description: Spicy in aroma and mouthfeel, this is a wondrous wine, gorgeous in lovely ripe cherry and strawberry notes that are completely enveloped in thrills of white pepper. Those who love cool climate Rhônes will find much to ponder and celebrate. Racy, it is fragrant and lean, made without fining or filtering. Seek this one out.
title: Donkey & Goat 2012 Grenache Noir Grenache (El Dorado)

description: This delicately perfumed wine opens to reveal power combined with elegance. The wine has great ripeness—a soft texture on the surface masking the severe tannins at the center.
title: Ramos-Pinto 2011 Vintage  (Port)

description: A tad riper, fuller and richer than the 2009 vintage, this wine is deep, subtle and complex, with a myriad of fruit and mineral flavors. Cassis, olive, fresh herb, toast, caramel and coconut are all in play, balanced and layered. The wine is young, tart and full of promise for the long term; hold at least 10–15 years.
designation: Collaboration Series I Ciel du Cheval Vineyard
title: Force Majeure 2010 Collaboration Series I Ciel du Cheval Vineyard Red (Red Mountain)

description: Tannic and concentrated, this is a powerful wine from its first moment. Ripe perfumes confirm the wine's richness, while acidity and density show strongly. Power and concentration match big berry fruit and finishing acidity.
title: C. da Silva 2011 Dalva Distinctive Vintage  (Port)

description: Fruit and acidity dominate the initial impression. The wine certainly has power and richness, as it's full in the mouth, juicy and fruity. In the background, there is a darker element, solid and dense, promising long-term aging.
title: Niepoort 2011  Port

description: Violet perfume, sweet fruit and a rich character make this wine immediately appealing. Delve into it and the tannins emerge, powerful in character. Berries and sweet, ripe plums complete this serious, impressive wine.
title: Taylor Fladgate 2011 Quinta da Eira Velha Vintage  (Port)

description: A densely tannic wine, firm at the center and richly fruity on the outside. It is concentrated, with acidity shooting through the jammy black fruit. It's a finely structured wine, likely to age well, but showing its rich side already.
title: Quinta de la Rosa 2011 Estate Bottled Vintage  (Port)

description: Smooth and rich, concentrated and dense. Dusty tannins power the dark fruit and sweet texture. Black plums and acidity match the dry, tannic structure.
title: Quinta do Vallado 2011 Vintage  (Port)

description: This shows very sweet fruit that's ripe, dense and already delicious. That doesn't mean the tannins don't bring out the firmness at the core of this powerful wine. It is integrated, packed with black plum flavors, and full bodied. For long-term aging.
title: Croft 2011 Vintage  (Port)

description: Big, bold and fruity, this wine shows richness, opulence and swathes of black plum fruit that cushions the structure. Powerful and fruity now, with long aging potential shown by the ample tannins and acid.
title: Quinta do Passadouro 2011 Vintage  (Port)

description: Very fine and complex, this is a great sparkling wine, but one that needs lots of time in the bottle. A classic brut blended with Pinot Noir and Chardonnay, it's rich with flavors of strawberries, limes, vanilla and honey, with lots of smoky toast and yeastiness. Above all, the mousse is exceptionally refined and pure.
title: Schramsberg 2005 Reserve Sparkling (North Coast)

description: A solid, ripe, fruity wine, rich in tannins that blend well into the texture. Black plum skins, damsons and berry fruit are all present, revealing the natural freshness of the vintage as well as great potential. A wine with a long life.
title: Cálem 2011  Port

description: This Perli is a gem, a gorgeous reminder that California Syrah can be a liquified representation of beauty. Carrying violet overtones, the wine offers just-picked raspberry and a pronounced entry of peppery spice. Soft it has a long finish and complex subtleties approaching magic. Sit this wine in your cellar if you dare—it's so good to drink now.
title: Donkey & Goat 2010 Perli Vineyard Syrah (Mendocino Ridge)

description: If you're looking for sheer flash in Napa Valley Cabernet, try this one. It's expensive, but worth the price. It dazzles for soft lusciousness, and the depth and complexity of blackberries, black currants, cassis and chocolate, as well as the perfect integration of new French oak. Yet the wine, which contains a splash of Malbec, is dry and balanced in acidity and velvety tannins. Great now, and will continue to please through 2022.
designation: Oak Knoll Ranch Lamoreaux Vineyards Vintner Select
title: Sequoia Grove 2009 Oak Knoll Ranch Lamoreaux Vineyards Vintner Select Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)

description: Made by Long Shadows winemaker Gilles Nicault, this wine, along with the 2008 and 2009 vintages, were released together. This is the most mature—a five-grape, Bordeaux-style blend. It's a beautifully integrated, floral and dusty wine, with contoured, sculpted fruit. Plums and cherries dominate, with dustings of cocoa powder, coffee and a hint of hazelnut. The wine is graceful and profound, with superb length and finesse.
title: Shoup 2007 Red (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Made from 100% Corvina, this shows the great potential of this native grape. It boasts rich blackberry, plum and licorice flavors, beautifully balanced and velvety smooth. This shows great depth and, while delicious now, hold for a few more years to allow additional complexities to develop.
title: Allegrini 2009 La Poja Monovitigno Corvina (Veronese)
